meanings.definition: Extremely realistic; resembling reality to an exaggerated degree.
meanings.sent1: The hyperrealistic painting of the ocean made it look almost like a photograph.
meanings.sent2: The artist's hyperrealistic portraits captured every tiny detail of the subject's face.
meanings.sent3: The hyperrealistic drawing of a banana peel made it seem like it was about to slip away.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperrealistic description of the crime scene painted a vivid picture in the detective's mind.
meanings.sent5: The hyperrealistic sculpture of a flower seemed so lifelike that it fooled many visitors.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a style of art characterized by detailed and precise representation of objects.
meanings.sent1: The hyperrealistic art exhibition showcased paintings that looked almost like photographs.
meanings.sent2: The hyperrealistic approach to still life painting requires great attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: In the hyperrealistic world of cartoons, even the animated characters seem tangible.
meanings.sent4: The hyperrealistic depiction of the city skyline in the mural was awe-inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The hyperrealistic details in the artist's work brought the scenes to life before the viewers' eyes.
